content: Some PRs need action from the author, but the author doesn't know what to do. See for example https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75127 and https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/71780. These shouldn't be marked as S-waiting-on-review because they're not ready for review, but S-waiting-on-author puts the onus on the author to figure things out.

I think S-waiting-on-help would communicate the situation more clearly to the triage team without ending up with situations like https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72412#issuecomment-641929056 where the triage comment just makes the author uncomfortable because they don't know what to do.
hm wait, it's unrelated but we shouldn't close #72412?
the idea of S-waiting-on-help sounds good to me
what's the procedure for adding that? should I just do it right now? :laughing:

usually we can add some other labels e.g. areas, features, diagnostics, etc. without discussion iirc but in this case it's better to hear some thoughts from other members (maybe T-compiler?), I think. anyway I don't think I'm the right member to decide :P
Following up because I don't want it to get lost - should I raise this in #t-compiler/meetings ?

Joshua Nelson said:

Following up because I don't want it to get lost - should I raise this in #t-compiler/meetings ?

:+1:
i mean it's not compiler specific, it can be useful to other teams as well
should we move this to #general then?
Also, maybe a S-waiting-on-mcp might be good too?
I think S-blocked works pretty well for that
I think it makes sense given we have S-waiting-on-fcp
brought it up in the stream for the meeting for this week
